intro: Epidendrum tumuc-humaciense, commonly known as the Tumuc-Humaciense Epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic lifestyle. Its leaves are usually dark green and革质 (leathery), providing structural support for its aerial roots. This orchid is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in tropical gardens.
